etymologies: 1920s; earliest use found in Chemical Abstracts. From French parsonsite from the name of Arthur Leonard Parsons, Canadian mineralogist + -ite

definitions: A hydrated triclinic phosphate of lead and uranium, Pb₂ (UO₂)(PO₄)₂ ·2H₂ O, occurring as crusts and powdery aggregates of transparent or translucent, minute, lath-like crystals.
